description.p: Sacred weapons are often believed to be blessed by gods, goddesses, or other divine entities. They may represent important values or beliefs like symbols of faith, honor, or heritage. Some sacred weapons have a storied history or legendary provenance. Sacred weapons are typically wielded by champions, heroes, or religious leaders for specific purposes. In some traditions, sacred weapons are believed to offer protection against supernatural forces, evil spirits, or otherworldly threats.

setters.set: You can introduce sacred weapons to your campaign.

description.p: Trick weapons are weapons that can be transformed into alternate forms and have different abilities depending on said form. To be proficient with a trick weapon, a character must be proficient with both states of the weapon.

If a character isn’t proficient with one of the forms of the weapon, they don’t add their proficiency bonus to attack rolls made with that form of the weapon, as would be the case for not being proficient with a ‘regular’ weapon. If a character is proficient with at least one form of the weapon, they can use all properties of the weapon.

setters.set: You can introduce trick weapons to your campaign.

description.p: Chain blades are exotic weapons that consist of a pair of connected blades attached to a chain, with a handle in the center. The wielder can wrap the chains around their arm to gain better control over the weapon's movements and attacks. The chain blades can be swung around in a wide arc, making them effective against multiple opponents.
A sleek, curved blade designed for precision and lethality, the scythe excels in sweeping attacks that can cut down foes from afar, in a graceful motion.
A brutal, heavy cleaver that delivers devastating, bone-crushing strikes, perfect for cleaving through armor and flesh alike with relentless force.
